etymology.description: 开瓶 + 器 = device for opening bottles.
etymology.interpretation: Literally “bottle-opening device”; refers to any tool used to remove caps or corks from bottles.
etymology.simplification: “开” is the simplified form of “開”, dropping the 門 enclosure to reduce strokes; “瓶” and “器” are unchanged.

examples.chinese: 你有开瓶器吗(你有開瓶器嗎)。
examples.pinyin: Nǐ yǒu kāi píng qì ma?
examples.english: Do you have a bottle opener?

examples.chinese: 他用开瓶器把啤酒盖撬开(他用開瓶器把啤酒蓋撬開)。
examples.pinyin: Tā yòng kāi píng qì bǎ píjiǔ gài qiào kāi.
examples.english: He used a bottle opener to pry open the beer cap.

examples.chinese: 这种开瓶器还能拔木塞(這種開瓶器還能拔木塞)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè zhǒng kāi píng qì hái néng bá mù sāi.
examples.english: This kind of bottle opener can also pull corks.
